messages.message: @Eric Han is there another preview window which needs the same code fix?
Based on the error the contents are coming from an S3 bucket (not our backend)
no i think this pdf is being rendered differently than the doc widget.
we use player.vimeo.com (http://player.vimeo.com) in the mobile view (which is why its in the policy)
@Aayush can you point me to the code for this API? Im not familiar with how it works

Also not sure if there is some other issue specificlly with this app, but I tried 4 different runs and all are failing https://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com/hub/apps/71cb6ac8-d488-43b3-95f4-f37680a66636
@Xindi Xu might be able to help out on this one as well.

ok i looked at the code quickly for doc translation, it looks like we use an “embed” tag to load files directly from file system. The object-src directive is what’s blocking it. But i would’ve thought ’self” covers the own url?

Yes right, it uses the embed tag to load it `webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/components/BatchResults/CustomAppResults/DocTranslationAppResults.tsx`
I have been testing on aihub-uat, let me check aihub-sandbox
Ok looks like app run issue on aihub-sandbox is tracked here https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C053455QN1M/p1705425525858179

maybe we can add `https://insan-aihub-uat-s3-bucket-driving-kiwi.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/` to the list of allowed src ? I’m also a bit confused why that bucket url is being used to reference/render the file when it’s our url that’s being used
Does embed retrieve the data from our backend or does it proxy through s3?
